title: Learning to detect cloud and snow in remote sensing images from noisy labels. (arXiv:2401.08932v1 [cs.CV])
abstract: Detecting clouds and snow in remote sensing images is an essential preprocessing task for remote sensing imagery. Previous works draw inspiration from semantic segmentation models in computer vision, with most research focusing on improving model architectures to enhance detection performance. However, unlike natural images, the complexity of scenes and the diversity of cloud types in remote sensing images result in many inaccurate labels in cloud and snow detection datasets, introducing unnecessary noises into the training and testing processes. By constructing a new dataset and proposing a novel training strategy with the curriculum learning paradigm, we guide the model in reducing overfitting to noisy labels. Additionally, we design a more appropriate model performance evaluation method, that alleviates the performance assessment bias caused by noisy labels. By conducting experiments on models with UNet and Segformer, we have validated the effectiveness of our proposed method. This

translated_title: 学习从噪声标签中检测遥感图像中的云和雪
translated_abstract: 检测遥感图像中的云和雪是遥感图像的重要预处理任务。以前的工作借鉴了计算机视觉中的语义分割模型，大部分研究集中在改进模型结构以提高检测性能。然而，与自然图像不同，遥感图像中场景的复杂性和云类型的多样性导致云和雪检测数据集中存在许多不准确的标签，导致训练和测试过程中引入了不必要的噪声。通过构建一个新的数据集并提出一种新的训练策略，即课程学习模式，我们引导模型减少对噪声标签的过拟合。此外，我们设计了一种更合适的模型性能评估方法，缓解了由噪声标签引起的性能评估偏差。通过在UNet和Segformer模型上进行实验，我们验证了我们提出的方法的有效性。
tldr: 本研究通过构建新的数据集和引入课程学习方法，提出了一种用于遥感图像中云和雪检测的训练策略。同时，设计了一种更合适的模型性能评估方法，有效减少了由于噪声标签引起的性能评估偏差。
en_tdlr: This study proposes a new training strategy for cloud and snow detection in remote sensing images using a new dataset and curriculum learning approach. A more suitable model performance evaluation method is also designed to reduce assessment bias caused by noisy labels.
